result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin J Carter Smith

records.addlTxt: certified copy to DA (10/19/22--ma)
to Produce
Initial appearance on December 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

[ma] Case called at 8:33am 
Defendant Justin J Carter Smith appeared by zoom.  Attorney Jeffrey Shock appeared by zoom for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court reviews court record, including that Mr. Carter Smith remains eligible for SPD representation. 

The Court adjourns to allow counsel to be appointed. 

Mr. Carter Smith indicates that his federal case is 'held up' by this case. 

The Court appoints counsel at no cost to Mr. Carter Smith.

Mr. Carter Smith requests an in person hearing. 

The State is to prepare a writ for Mr. Carter Smith's appearance. 
recess: 8:36am  

NEXT:   Initial Appearance on 12/22/22 at 1:30pm IN PERSON [JA, Co-Def Jackson is set for Preliminary Hearing on 1/10/23 at 8:30am]
Status of Counsel
Initial appearance on October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[MK] case called at 1:40pm 
Defendant Justin J Carter Smith appears by Zoom videoconference from Stanley Correctional, in custody.  ADA Michael Witt appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court verifies with Mr. Carter Smith that he can see and hear the proceedings through the video-connection. 
This case is scheduled for Initial Appearance today, however the Public Defender has not appointed counsel yet.   
Mr. Carter Smith indicates that he has received a copy of the Criminal Complaint.  
recess 1:48pm 

NEXT:  Initial Appearance (and status of counsel hearing) on October 18th at same time as the Co-Defendant's case-- the State is to prepare a writ
Scheduling Order
Initial appearance on September 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

[ml] Cases 22CF157 and 22CF156 called at 8:33AM
Defendant Carter Smith appears via Zoom from the Stanley Correctional Facility, in custody and without counsel.
Defendant William Jackson does not appear. Att Cassi Nelson appears via Zoom.

As to file 22CF157:
Mr. Smith advises that he can see and hear the video connection.
Mr. Smith advises he continues to want counsel in these matters.
The Court finds good cause to continue to toll Preliminary Hearing time limits to allow for the Public Defender's Office to continue to try to appoint the Defendant counsel.
The Court sets this file over for Initial Appearance, and adjourns this file for today.


As to 22CF156:
Att Nelson informs the Court that Mr. Jackson will not be appearing today as he is attending court in another county, and requests that the Preliminary Hearing be rescheduled.

recess 8:40AM

NEXT:
22CF157: Preliminary Hearing on 09/23 at 1:15PM via Zoom
22CF156: Initial Appearance on 10/18 at 8:30AM
Status of Counsel

The Court reviews the court record, including that Mr. Carter Smith is SPD eligible.
